option.value: {"C:/MyWallet":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/FriendsActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `FriendsActivity`, which is responsible for managing the friends and friend requests functionality of a wallet application.\\n\\n`FriendsActivity`: This class handles the UI and logic for the friends and friend requests feature of the wallet application.\\n\\n`sendFriendRequest()`: This function sends a friend request to the specified username.\\n\\n`updateLists()`: This function updates the lists of friends and pending friend requests.\\n\\n`showSendMoneyDialog(String friendUsername)`: This function displays a dialog to allow the user to send money to a selected friend.\",\"/app/google-services.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON configuration file for a Firebase project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides information about the project, including the project number, project ID, and storage bucket. The file also includes client information, such as the mobile SDK app ID and package name, as well as API key and service information. This configuration file is likely used to set up and configure a Firebase-based application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/TransactionHistoryActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `TransactionHistoryActivity` class, which is responsible for displaying the transaction history for a specific user.\\n\\n`TransactionHistoryActivity`: This class extends `AppCompatActivity` and is responsible for displaying the transaction history for a specific user.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the activity is created. It sets up the layout, initializes the `DatabaseHelper` and `TransactionAdapter`, and populates the `RecyclerView` with the user\\u0027s transaction history.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/ExampleUnitTest.java\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test method. It does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: This is a unit test class that tests the basic functionality of the application.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: This test method checks that the addition operation is working correctly by asserting that 2 + 2 equals 4.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a simple example of a unit test for an Android application, which can be used as a starting point for writing more comprehensive tests.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/SettingsActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SettingsActivity`, which is responsible for managing the settings of a user\\u0027s account in a wallet application.\\n\\n`SettingsActivity`: This class handles the settings screen of the wallet application, allowing the user to update their profile information, change their password, and configure various settings such as dark mode, notifications, and biometric authentication.\\n\\n`loadSettings()`: This function loads the user\\u0027s current settings from the database and updates the corresponding UI elements.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This is the main entry point of the `SettingsActivity` class, where the UI is initialized, the current settings are loaded, and the event listeners for the various settings are set up.\\n\\n`updateProfile(View)`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Update Profile\\\" button, and it updates the user\\u0027s profile information in the database and displays a success or failure message.\\n\\n`changePassword(View)`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Change Password\\\" button, and it launches the `ChangePasswordActivity` to allow the user to change their password.\\n\\n`back(View)`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Back\\\" button, and it simply finishes the current activity.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/ChangePasswordActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`ChangePasswordActivity`: This class is responsible for handling the change password functionality in the MyWallet Android application.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreate()`: This function is the entry point of the `ChangePasswordActivity` class and is responsible for initializing the UI elements, setting up the event listeners, and handling the password change logic.\\n\\n`isPasswordStrong()`: This function checks if the new password entered by the user meets the required password strength criteria (at least 8 characters, containing letters, numbers, and special characters).\\n\\nOverall, this file implements the change password functionality for the MyWallet Android application, allowing users to update their passwords securely.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/ExampleInstrumentedTest.java\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app called \\\"MyWallet\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and checks the context of the app under test.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test method checks if the package name of the app under test matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/LoginActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `LoginActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the login functionality of the MyWallet application.\\n\\n`LoginActivity`: This class extends `AppCompatActivity` and is responsible for handling the login process, including loading saved credentials, requesting password resets, and validating user input.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the activity is created, and it initializes the UI elements, loads saved credentials, and sets up click listeners for the login, register, and forgot password buttons.\\n\\n`btnForgotPassword.setOnClickListener(...)`: This click listener handles the \\\"Forgot Password\\\" functionality, where the user can request a password reset by entering their username or email.\\n\\n`btnLogin.setOnClickListener(...)`: This click listener handles the login process, where it validates the user\\u0027s input, checks the user\\u0027s credentials against the database, and saves the credentials if the \\\"Remember Me\\\" option is selected.\\n\\n`btnGoToRegister.setOnClickListener(...)`: This click listener navigates the user to the `RegisterActivity` when the \\\"Go to Register\\\" button is clicked.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/DatabaseHelper.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `DatabaseHelper`, which is a SQLite database helper class for a wallet application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the class and its functions:\\n\\n`DatabaseHelper`: A class that provides methods for managing a SQLite database for a wallet application, including user management, transactions, friends, and settings.\\n\\n`onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)`: Creates the necessary tables in the database when the application is first installed.\\n\\n`onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion)`: Handles database schema upgrades by adding new columns or tables as needed.\\n\\n`addUser(String username, String email, String password, String fullName, double balance)`: Adds a new user to the database.\\n\\n`getBalance(String username)`: Retrieves the current balance for a given user.\\n\\n`updateBalance(String username, double newBalance)`: Updates the balance for a given user.\\n\\n`hashPassword(String password)`: Hashes a password using SHA-256 algorithm.\\n\\n`checkUser(String usernameOrEmail, String password, boolean isEmail)`: Checks if a user with the given username or email and password exists in the database.\\n\\n`isEmailExists(String email)`: Checks if the given email already exists in the database.\\n\\n`verifyEmail(String username, String token)`: Verifies a user\\u0027s email by checking the provided token.\\n\\n`requestPasswordReset(String email)`: Generates a reset token for the user with the given email.\\n\\n`updatePassword(String username, String newPassword)`: Updates the password for a given user.\\n\\n`resetPassword(String resetToken, String newPassword)`: Resets the password for a user using the provided reset token.\\n\\n`isUsernameExists(String username)`: Checks if the given username already exists in the database.\\n\\n`addTransaction(String username, double amount, String type)`: Adds a new transaction for a given user.\\n\\n`getTransactions(String username)`: Retrieves the list of transactions for a given user.\\n\\n`sendFriendRequest(String fromUser, String toUser)`: Sends a friend request from one user to another.\\n\\n`acceptFriendRequest(String user, String friendUser)`: Accepts a friend request.\\n\\n`rejectFriendRequest(String user, String friendUser)`: Rejects a friend request.\\n\\n`getFriends(String username)`: Retrieves the list of friends for a given user.\\n\\n`getPendingFriendRequests(String username)`: Retrieves the list of pending friend requests for a given user.\\n\\n`sendMoneyToFriend(String fromUser, String toUser, double amount)`: Transfers money from one user to another.\\n\\n`updateUserProfile(String username, String fullName, String email)`: Updates a user\\u0027s profile information.\\n\\n`updateProfilePicture(String username, String picturePath)`: Updates a user\\u0027s profile picture.\\n\\n`setSetting(String username, String key, String value)`: Saves a user setting.\\n\\n`getSetting(String username, String key)`: Retrieves a user setting.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/RegisterActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `RegisterActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the user registration process in the MyWallet Android application.\\n\\n`RegisterActivity`: This class extends the `AppCompatActivity` and is responsible for handling the user registration process, including validating user input, creating a new user account in the database, and navigating to the login screen upon successful registration.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is the entry point of the `RegisterActivity` class and is responsible for initializing the UI components, setting up the click listeners for the registration and login buttons, and handling the user registration process.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is the click listener for the registration button and is responsible for validating the user input, creating a new user account in the database, and navigating to the login screen upon successful registration.\\n\\n`onClick(View)`: This function is the click listener for the \\\"Go to Login\\\" button and is responsible for navigating to the login screen.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/MainActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `MainActivity` class, which is the main activity of the Android application. The file does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the Android application that handles the user interface and interactions for managing the user\\u0027s wallet, including adding money, sending money, viewing transaction history, and accessing the friends list.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Initializes the UI components and the `DatabaseHelper` class.\\n2. Retrieves the username from the intent and updates the balance display.\\n3. Implements click listeners for the various buttons, which perform actions such as adding money, sending money, viewing transaction history, and accessing the friends list.\\n4. Provides helper functions to update the balance display and interact with the database.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/mehedi860/mywallet/TransactionAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `TransactionAdapter` class, which is responsible for managing the display of transaction data in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`TransactionAdapter`: A class that extends `RecyclerView.Adapter` and is responsible for providing the data and views for a list of transactions.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: A function that creates a new `TransactionViewHolder` instance and inflates the view for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: A function that binds the data for a specific transaction to the corresponding views in the `TransactionViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: A function that returns the number of transactions in the list.\\n\\n`TransactionViewHolder`: A static inner class that extends `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` and holds references to the views that display the transaction details.\"}"}
